intro: Calandrinia maryonii, commonly known as Maryon's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Calandrinia maryonii is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
